alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 02 at 5:48PM CST until March 04 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Muskogee and Sequoyah. In southeast Oklahoma, Haskell, Latimer, Pittsburg and Pushmataha. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sallisaw... Wilburton... Stigler... Clayton... Hartshorne... Vian... Quinton... Gore... Porum... Webbers Falls... Keota... Red Oak... Mccurtain... Whitefield... Rattan... Kinta... Marble City... Tamaha... Albion... Damon... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
